SEARCH
Package Taskpplication

Class Day

java.lang.Object
Taskpplication.Day
public class Day extends Object
This class is a representation of a day in the calendar which has it's own specific date. The Day class has a list of all the tasks associated with it and a dayID for the database to recognize it. It also has an instance of the TaskDAO so this code can interact with the database is need be. See below for details on implementation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Day

      public Day(LocalDate ld, Task[] tl, int id)
      This constructor intializes an instance of the Day class with the given parameters. This is the most specific constructor.
      Parameters:
      ld - Date of the Day to be created
      tl - Array of task already associated with that day in the database
      id - Id of the day in the database

    • Day

      public Day(LocalDate ld)
      This constructor just creates an instance of the day class given the local date parameter.
      Parameters:
      ld - Date of the Day to be created

    • add_task

      public boolean add_task(String title, String description, String group, LocalDateTime dt)
      Add a task to the Day and the HashMap of tasks associated with the day with the parameters provided to the function
      Parameters:
      title - Title of the new task
      description - Description of the new task
      group - Group of the new task
      dt - Date and Time of the new task
      Returns:
      true if the task was created suscessfully

    • add_task

      public boolean add_task(Task t)
      Add a task object provided as a parameter to the Day and the HashMap of tasks associated with the day.
      Parameters:
      t - a Task to add to the database
      Returns:
      true if the task was added suscessfully

    • edit_title

      public boolean edit_title(int task_id, String new_title)
      This function edits the title of an existing task. The Id, and new title are provided as command line arguments.
      Parameters:
      task_id - The ID of the desired task
      new_title - The new title for the desired task
      Returns:
      true if the changes were made suscessfully
